snippet: The resulting jump in labor-related production costs, which occurred at the same time as a big drop in economic growth, will be temporary, according to the Federal Reserve.
abstract: Labor Dept says worker productivity fell at its fastest pace in a year in the first quarter of 2014 as harsh winter weather restrained output, leading to jump in labor-related production costs; productivity declined at a 1.7 percent annual rate, biggest drop since first quarter of 2013.
lead_paragraph: The resulting jump in labor-related production costs, which occurred at the same time as a big drop in economic growth, will be temporary, according to the Federal Reserve.

headline.main: Worker Productivity Falls at Its Fastest Pace in a Year
headline.print_headline: Worker Productivity Falls at Its Fastest Pace in a Year
